sections.heading: What is a Proprietorship Firm?
content: A proprietorship firm is a business structure where a single individual owns and operates the entire business.
It is the simplest form of business organization with minimal legal formalities and complete control with the owner.
The proprietor is personally liable for all debts and obligations of the business.

points: Ideal for small businesses and freelancers

sections.heading: Proprietorship Registration – Overview
content: A proprietorship is the most popular business structure in India for startups, traders, consultants, freelancers, and small businesses.
A proprietorship does not have a separate legal identity. The business and the owner are treated as the same under law.

sections.heading: How is a Proprietorship Registered?
content: Unlike LLPs or Private Limited Companies, proprietorships do not have a single central registration.
Legal recognition is achieved through essential registrations and licenses.

points: Current Bank Account in business name

list.title: Single Ownership
points: One individual owns and manages the business.

list.title: No Separate Legal Entity
points: The business and the proprietor are legally the same.

list.title: Unlimited Liability
points: The owner is personally responsible for all business liabilities.

list.title: Easy Formation and Closure
points: Minimal paperwork and no formal winding-up process.

rows: No complex registration or legal formalities. Operations can start quickly with basic licenses.

sections.heading: Timeline
content: The complete proprietorship registration process usually takes 7 to 15 business days.

sections.heading: Comparison: Proprietorship vs Private Limited Company vs LLP

list.title: Is proprietorship registration mandatory?
points: No, but GST, MSME, or Shop Act registration is required to operate legally.

list.title: Can I open a bank account for proprietorship?
points: Yes, with GST, MSME, or Shop Act registration.

list.title: Is GST compulsory for proprietorship?
points: Only if turnover exceeds the threshold or for interstate sales.

list.title: Can a proprietorship be converted later?
points: Yes, it can be converted into an LLP or Private Limited Company.

list.title: Can I register a trademark for proprietorship?
points: Yes, trademarks can be registered in the proprietor’s name.
